    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomWalker

        public RandomWalker(java.lang.Integer walker,
                    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> solverControl,
                    GlobalParameters globalParameters,
                    CentralProcessor centralProcessor)
        constructs a new taskSupplier of type RandomWalker. The constructor is called serially. Therefore there are no race conditions. globalParameters and centralProcessor are shared between different threads. The walker is passive in the sense that it does not send data to the CentralDataHolder.
        Parameters:
        walker - counts the constructed walker
        solverControl - contains the parameters for controlling the solger
        globalParameters - contains the global control parameters
        centralProcessor - contains the result of parsing and initializing the problem data.

    • Method Detail

      • parseParameters

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> parseParameters(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                                                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer errors,
                                                                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer warnings)
        parses a HashMap with key-value pairs
        Parameters:
        parameters - the parameters with the keys "seed", "flips", "jumps"
        errors - for error messages
        warnings - for warnings
        Returns:
        a list of HashMaps with these keys.

      • addObservers

        protected void addObservers()
        Description copied from class: Solver
        This method adds observers to the local process and the centralProcessor. The centralProcessor is observed and may insert tasks in the local task queue
        Overrides:
        addObservers in class Solver

      • initializeModel

        private void initializeModel()
        generates a candidate rwModel for the clauses. A predicate becomes true if it occurs in more clauses than its negation.

      • updateClause

        private void updateClause(Clause clause,
                          int change)
        adds (change = 1) or removes (change = -1) a clause. Updates flipScore and falseClauses
        Parameters:
        clause - a clause
        change - +1 for adding the clause, -1 for removing the clause.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of clauses containing the literal and its implied literals.

      • initializeQueue

        private void initializeQueue()

        Parameters:

      • findOtherTrueLiteral

        private CLiteral findOtherTrueLiteral(CLiteral cLiteral)
        searches for the only other true literal besides the given one
        Parameters:
        cLiteral - a CLiteral
        Returns:
        a true literal where all others except the given one are false, null if no such literal exists.

      • changeScore

        private void changeScore(int literal,
                         int difference)
        changes the flipScore of the given literal and updates the predicateQueue
        Parameters:
        literal - an literal
        difference - the change to the score

      • updateScores

        private void updateScores()
        updates the flip scores and the predicate queue. Since the order in the queue may depend on several predicates, one must first remove all affected predicates from the queue, then update the scores and then add the predicate to the queue.
